Within?|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/programmes/peopleandpower/2016/10/armenia-divided-161026070435409.html|agency=[[Al Jazeera]]|date=27 October 2016|quote=...the territories lost during the April 2016|quote=...the April War of 2016.}}{{cite news|last1=Nersisyan|first1=Leonid|title=A Frozen War in Russia's Backyard Heats Up|url=http://nationalinterest.org/feature/frozen-war-russias-backyard-heats-17085|work=[[The National Interest]]|date=24 July 2016|quote=...the short but bloody April war.}} {{lang-hy|ապրիլյան պատերազմ}}, ''aprilyan paterazm''{{cite news|title=Արցախի հյուսիսային սահման. ապրիլյան պատերազմը լուսանկարներում|url=http://hetq.am/arm/news/67089/arcakhi-hyusisayin-sahman-aprilyan-paterazmy-lusankarnerum.html|work=[[Hetq]]|date=6 April 2016|language=hy}}}} began along the [[Nagorno-Karabakh line of contact]] on 1 April 2016 with the [[Artsakh Defense Army]], backed by the [[Armenian Armed Forces]], on one side and the [[Azerbaijani Armed Forces]] on the other. The clashes occurred in a region that is disputed between the [[de facto]] [[Republic of Artsakh]] and [[Azerbaijan]]. The region includes [[Nagorno-Karabakh]] and [[Armenian-controlled territories surrounding Nagorno-Karabakh|surrounding areas]]. Azerbaijani forces sought to regain territory formerly within the [[History of the Soviet Union|Soviet-era]] [[Nagorno-Karabakh Autonomous Oblast]]. The clashes have been defined as "the worst" since the [[Bishkek Protocol|1994 ceasefire]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35949991|title=Nagorno-Karabakh violence: Worst clashes in decades kill dozens|work=BBC News|accessdate=22 April 2016}} The battles resulted in the conquest of the Azerbaijani Armed Forces, the hills around the Talish village of Terter and Seysulan village, Lala hill of Jabrayil region and Cocuq Marjanli, Gulustan village of Goranboy region and the ways to Madaqiz village of Terter region were taken back from Armenians.{{cite web|title=Aprel zəfərinin il dönümüdür|url=http://cebhe.info/aprel-zeferinin-ildonumudur--azad-olunmus-eraziler-54692|publisher=cebhe.info|accessdate=25 November 2017|archiveurl=http://archive.is/gnkXo|archivedate=25 November 2017}} A ceasefire was reached on 5 April and the agreement was reached between the chiefs of the armed forces of Azerbaijan and Armenia in Moscow,{{Cite web |url=http://mod.gov.az/index2.php?content=news%2F2016%2F20160406_atespoz# |title=Ermənistan silahlı qüvvələrinin bölmələri tərəfindən atəşkəs yenə də pozulmaqdadır |access-date=23 November 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161004165543/http://www.mod.gov.az/index2.php?content=news%2F2016%2F20160406_atespoz# |archive-date=4 October 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} however, both sides accused each other of violations. Azerbaijan claimed to have regained 2,000 hectares of land, while Armenian officials suggested a loss of 800 hectares of land of no strategic importance. The US State Department estimated that a total of 350 people—military and civilian—died.{{cite web | url =https://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2016/05/257263.htm| archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20160517072824/http://www.state.gov/r/pa/prs/ps/2016/05/257263.htm| dead-url =yes| archive-date =17 May 2016|title=Background Briefing on the Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict|publisher=[[U.S. State Department]]| date=16 May 2016| accessdate =17 May 2016}} Official sources of the warring parties put those estimates either much higher or much lower, depending on the source. == Background == {{Further|Nagorno-Karabakh conflict|Armenian–Azerbaijani War|Nagorno-Karabakh War}} The [[Nagorno-Karabakh War]] ended with a [[Bishkek Protocol|ceasefire agreement]] between the warring parties that came into effect on 12 May 1994. Since then, both Azerbaijan and Armenia have reported over 7,000 breaches of the ceasefire;{{cite web | url =http://ru.apa.az/news/313223 |title=В марте армянские вооруженные подразделения нарушили режим прекращения огня 3746 раз|publisher=[[Azerbaijan Press Agency|APA]]|language=Russian| date=1 April 2016| accessdate =6 April 2016}}{{cite web | url =http://www.newsru.com/world/04jun2011/karabah.html |title=Минобороны Азербайджана: новая война за Карабах неизбежна|publisher=NEWSru.com| date=4 June 2011| language=Russian|accessdate =6 April 2016}} more than 100 breaches of the ceasefire were reported and 12 Azerbaijani soldiers had been killed in 2015 alone. The April 2016 clashes have been the most serious breach of the 1994 ceasefire to date.{{cite web|url=http://reliefweb.int/report/azerbaijan/nagorno-karabakh-conflict-situation-report-no-1-03-apr-2016|archive-url=https://archive.is/20160404094519/http://reliefweb.int/report/azerbaijan/nagorno-karabakh-conflict-situation-report-no-1-03-apr-2016|dead-url=yes|archive-date=4 April 2016|title=Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict Situation Report No. 1 (as of 03 Apr 2016)|date=3 April 2016|publisher=[[ReliefWeb]]|accessdate=4 April 2016}} Among the possible reasons behind the conflict escalation is Azerbaijan's worsening economy. The [[Price of oil#2015-16 prices: The lows of January 2016|collapse of oil prices in 2015–16]] has been frequently cited, with clashes being used to distract the Azerbaijani population from rising prices and unemployment.{{cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/news/europe/21696563-after-facing-decades-armenia-and-azerbaijan-start-shooting-frozen-conflict-explodes|title=A frozen conflict explodes|date=9 April 2016|publisher=The Economist|accessdate=3 June 2016}} Alternatively, some Armenian sources blame Turkey for provoking violence. Some Turkish commentators have suggested a Russian strategy to destabilize the region. == Clashes == The fighting has focused mainly on the front line with a length of 257 km.{{cite journal|last1=Broers|first1=Laurence|title=The Nagorny Karabakh Conflict Defaulting to War|journal=The Royal Institute of International Affairs|date=July 2016|url=https://www.chathamhouse.org/sites/files/chathamhouse/publications/research/NK%20paper%2024082016%20WEB.pdf|accessdate=25 November 2017}} Each side blamed the other for the outbreak of clashes around the towns of [[Aghdara (town)|Aghdara]], [[Tartar (city)|Tartar]], [[Agdam]], [[Khojavend (town)|Khojavend]], and [[Füzuli|Fuzuli]].{{cite web | url =http://tass.ru/mezhdunarodnaya-panorama/3171918|title=В боях в зоне карабахского конфликта погибли 12 военнослужащих ВС Азербайджана|publisher=[[Russian News Agency TASS|TASS]]| language=Russian|date=2 April 2016| accessdate =2 April 2016}} According to Armenian sources, on the night of 1 April and early morning of 2 April, the Azerbaijani side launched large-scale attacks along the contact line between Karabakh and Azerbaijan. On 2 April, a 12-year-old Armenian boy was killed as a result of missile artillery attack from a [[BM-21 Grad]] near the border with [[Martuni (town)|Martuni]].{{cite news|title=12-year-old Vaghinak Grigoryan killed in Azeri shelling|url=http://www.horizonweekly.ca/news/details/83600|agency=Horizon|date=2 April 2016}} Two other children were wounded as well.{{cite web | url=http://nkrmil.am/main/en/newsMore1240.html | archive-url=https://archive.is/20160405055500/http://nkrmil.am/main/en/newsMore1240.html | dead-url=yes | archive-date=5 April 2016 | title=(02/04/16 [10:25]) Press release | publisher=NKRmil.am | accessdate=4 April 2016}} According to Azerbaijani sources, on 2 April, Azerbaijani positions and inhabited places near the [[front line]] came under fire from Armenian military, armed with [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar]]s and high caliber [[grenade launcher]]s, that killed 2 people and wounded 10 civilians.{{cite web | url =http://www.mod.gov.az/index2.php?content=news/2016/20160402_melumat_cebheson|title=Cəbhədə vəziyyətlə bağlı son məlumat|publisher=Ministry of Defense of Azerbaijan| language=Azerbaijani|date=2 April 2016| accessdate =2 April 2016}}Armenian Armed Forces violated ceasefire 127 times during the day, using 82 and 120-millimeter mortars and huge machine guns in different directions of the frontline.{{cite web|title=Düşmən iriçaplı pulemyotlardan da istifadə etməklə mövqelərimizi atəşə tutub|url=http://www.1news.az/az/news/dusmen-iricapli-pulemyotlardan-da-istifade-etmekle-movqelerimizi-atese-tutub|publisher=www.1news.az|accessdate=27 November 2017}} According to the Azerbaijani Ministry of Defense, during a rapid counter-offensive, the Armenian side's front defense line was broken in multiple places and several strategic heights and inhabited places were retaken (including the strategically important hill of [[Lalatapa]]). An [[Agence France-Presse|AFP]] journalist confirmed that the [[Lalatapa]] heights were also under Azerbaijani control.{{cite web|last1=AFP |title=Fragile truce holds in Karabakh after four days of deadly clashes |url=https://au.news.yahoo.com/world/a/31286381/fragile-truce-holds-in-karabakh-after-four-days-of-deadly-clashes/ |accessdate=24 April 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160425045536/https://au.news.yahoo.com/world/a/31286381/fragile-truce-holds-in-karabakh-after-four-days-of-deadly-clashes/ |archivedate=25 April 2016 }} The Azerbaijani side claimed that they had captured some areas, including heights near the village of [[Talış, Tartar|Talysh]], as well as the village of [[Seysulan]].{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/news/armenia-azerbaijan-fighting-surges-along-karabakh-frontline-090716406.html|title=Azerbaijan, Armenia forces clash as Putin urges ceasefire|publisher=}} Unmanned aerial vehicle of Armenia was shot down in Fuzuli as well.{{cite web|title=Qarabağda ermənilərin pilotsuz uçuş aparatı məhv edildi|url=http://www.interpress.az/34142-qarabada-ermnilrin-pilotsuz-uu-aparat-mhv-edildi.html#.WhuRqVVl-Uk|publisher=www.interpress.az|accessdate=27 November 2017}}. However, the Ministry of Defence of Nagorno-Karabakh says this claim is untrue.{{cite web|url=https://armenpress.am/eng/news/842027/nkr-defense-army-seysulan-remains-armenian-land-as-it-used-to-be-before.html|title=NKR Defense Army: Seysulan remains Armenian land, as it used to be before|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}} On 8 May the Armenia's First Channel release footage from military positions near Seysulan.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gsbWn7W9tc8|title=ՄԱՐՏԱԿԱՆ ԴԻՐՔԻ ԿՈՐՈՒՍՏՆ ՈՒ ՎԵՐԱԴԱՐՁԸ|first=|last=Popular on Youtube-Armenia|date=8 May 2016|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016|via=YouTube}} 14,400 people living in villages were affected by clashes, but no [[internal displacement]] or immediate humanitarian need was reported. Armenian Defense Ministry spokesman [[Artsrun Hovhannisyan]] sharply accused Azerbaijan of "launching an unprovoked coordinated ground offensive against Armenia’s forces", saying the Azerbaijani military used warplanes, tanks and artillery to try to make inroads into Nagorno-Karabakh.{{cite web|url=http://georgiatoday.ge/news/3446/Heavy-Fighting-Erupts-in-Nagorny-Karabakh|title=Heavy Fighting Erupts in Nagorny-Karabakh|work=Georgia Today on the Web}} During the first day of fighting, Armenian forces claimed to have destroyed at least three Azerbaijani tanks, two military helicopters (including an [[Mil Mi-24 variants|Mi-24G]] and at least one armed [[Mil Mi-8|Mil Mi-8/17]]) and two [[unmanned drone]]s, photographs and videos of which surfaced on the internet."[http://www.azatutyun.am/content/article/27649909.html ‘Large-Scale’ Fighting Reported In Karabakh]." ''[[RFE/RL]]''. 2 April 2016. Armenian frontline positions were reinforced, heavy artillery was brought forward, and in the NKR capital [[Stepanakert]] reservists were called up. On 3 April, Armenian military authorities announced that [[NKR]] forces had recaptured positions around Talysh,"[http://www.azatutyun.am/content/article/27651576.html Heavy Fighting Continues In Karabakh]." ''RFE/RL''. 3 April 2016. which the Azerbaijani Ministry of Defense claimed was untrue.{{cite web|url=http://haqqin.az/news/67245|title=Минобороны Азербайджана: "Армяне не отбивали высоту у селения Талыш"|publisher=Haqqin.az}} On 6 April, news footage shown on Armenia's First Channel revealed Armenian journalists and NKR troops freely mingling on the streets of Talysh and Madagiz.{{hy icon}} [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MbhxsQrldn0 Մեր սահմաններն անառիկ են]" [Our borders are impenetrable]. First Channel. 6 April 2016. On 8 April, news footage shown on an Azerbaijani TV channel showed the Azerbaijan military installations purported to be near the Talysh heights.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hqwzLfRt-_c |title=Qarabagda ermeni postunun ele kecirilmesi 04.04.2016 }}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VtqNf5rRcMk |title=Talış kəndi yüksəkliyindən İLK reportaj ANS TV}}{{cite web |url=http://www.anspress.com/siyaset/08-04-2016/ans-azad-edilen-talis-yuksekliyinde |title=ANS azad edilən Talış yüksəkliyində |access-date=17 April 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160419150422/http://www.anspress.com/siyaset/08-04-2016/ans-azad-edilen-talis-yuksekliyinde# |archive-date=19 April 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} On 11 April, news footage from Armenia's First channel showed the Talysh heights under the control of NKR troops.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3hgpn-FcHXM|title=ԱՊՐԻԼԻ 8, 2016 ՀՅՈՒՍԻՍԱՐԵՎԵԼՅԱՆ ԱՄԵՆԱԲԱՐԴ ՀԵՆԱԿԵՏԸ|first=|last=Popular on Youtube-Armenia|date=11 April 2016|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016|via=YouTube}} Again on 8 May, news footage from Civilnet showed journalist [[Tatul Hakobyan]] with some NKR soldiers at Talysh heights near [[Naftalan, Azerbaijan|Naftalan]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cxjjr0jwCOQ|title=Թալիշի վերագրավված դիրքերում|first=|last=CivilNet TV|date=8 May 2016|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016|via=YouTube}} Later, Defense Minister [[Zakir Hasanov]] stated that if shelling of Azerbaijani settlements by Armenian forces did not cease, Azerbaijan would consider launching an artillery bombardment on Stepanakert.{{cite web|url=http://haqqin.az/news/67335|title=Азербайджан может нанести удар по Степанакерту|work=Haqqin.az}} On the same day, the Azerbaijani Ministry of Defense announced a unilateral end to hostilities. The Azerbaijani Ministry of Defense stated that should Armenian shelling pursue, Azerbaijan would continue its offensive.{{cite web |url= http://haqqin.az/news/67220|title=Минобороны: Азербайджан в одностороннем порядке приостановил боевые действия|publisher=Haqqin.az|language=Russian| date=3 April 2016| accessdate =3 April 2016}} On 4 April, the Azerbaijani Ministry of Defense reported that an Armenian [[command and control]] center had been destroyed and released a video which captured footage of the attack. On 5 April, a strategically important military base in Madaghis which is on the main road leading to Aghdara city and a bus carrying "Yerkrapah" armenian volunteers were fired.{{cite web|last1=Sanchez|first1=Raf|title='Suicide drone' used for first time in fighting between Azerbaijan and Armenia|url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/04/08/suicide-drone-used-for-first-time-in-fighting-between-azerbaijan/|publisher=www.telegraph.co.uk|accessdate=27 November 2017}}{{cite web|title="Azerbaycan, Ermeni hedeflerini İsrail'in insansız hava araçlarıyla vurdu" iddiası|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/azerbaycan-ermeni-hedeflerini-israilin-insansiz-hava-araclariyla-vurdu-iddiasi-40083314|publisher=www.hurriyet.com.tr|accessdate=27 November 2017}} The Azerbaijani Ministry of Defense claimed that along with numerous military personnel, two high-ranking Armenian officers were killed as a result.{{cite web |url= http://haqqin.az/news/67287|title=Так сегодня уничтожили армянских генералов и полковников |publisher=Haqqin.az|language=Russian| date=4 April 2016| accessdate =4 April 2016}} The three deceased{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Armenian lieutenant colonels, were identified as Roman V. ===Transfer of bodies=== On 10 April, the State Commission on Prisoners of War, Hostages and Missing Persons of the Nagorno Karabakh Republic said that of the 18 bodies of Armenian soldiers transferred that same day by Azerbaijan, all showed signs of [[torture]] or [[mutilation]].{{Citation needed|date=June 2016}} The Commission called these acts "a flagrant manifestation of inhumanity, run counter to the laws and customs of war and are in grave violation of the international humanitarian law", adding that the Karabakh side will ensure that "such behavior of the Azerbaijani side is condemned in strongest terms by the international community and the specialized agencies".{{cite web|url=http://en.aravot.am/2016/04/11/175574/|title=All bodies of the deceased transferred by the Azerbaijani side had signs of torture and mutilation|work=Առավոտ – Նորություններ Հայաստանից|accessdate=12 April 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://galatv.am/ru/news/145364/|title=Заявление Государственной комиссии НКР по вопросам военнопленных, заложников и без вести пропавших|work=ԳԱԼԱ|accessdate=12 April 2016}} Azerbaijan's Ministry of Defense denied the accusations and claimed that the transferred bodies of Azerbaijani servicemen had been mutilated by the Armenian side.{{cite web|url=http://www.kavkaz-uzel.ru/articles/280712/|title=Кавказский Узел - Азербайджан опроверг заявления о глумлении над телами убитых|work=Кавказский Узел|accessdate=22 April 2016}} The NKR State Commission on Prisoners of War, Hostages and Missing Persons called this claim by Azerbaijan a cynical attempt to mislead the international community, observing that before the start of the exchange procedure, all the bodies of the dead soldiers had been examined in the presence of representatives of the International Committee of the Red Cross, and no traces of abuse or ill-treatment had been discovered or registered on Azerbaijani soldiers.Karabakh MFA: No traces of abuse or ill-treatment were discovered on bodies of Azerbaijani soldiers", A1+, 15 April 2016 [http://en.a1plus.am/1233704.html] ==Aftermath== ===Casualty estimates=== According to the US State Department, Azerbaijan "took a huge number of casualties, including comparatively", although the number was not specified. Overall, a senior member of the US State Department estimated 350 casualties on both sides, including civilians. According to the Russian analytical center Ostkraft the Azerbaijan army stopped its offensive against Karabakh because 800 Azerbaijani soldiers died during the clashes.{{cite web|url=http://regnum.ru/news/polit/2129092.html|title=OSTKRAFT: потери Азербайджана в Нагорном Карабахе в апреле — 800 человек - ИА REGNUM|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://ostkraft.ru/ru/news/1753|title=Стали известны реальные потери Азербайджана в ходе боев в Карабахе - OSTKRAFT|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}} Official estimates of the warring parties are far apart from each other. According to official statements of the involved sides, 90 Armenian and 31 Azerbaijani soldiers were killed during the clashes, and several pieces of military equipment from both sides were destroyed. Also according to official statements, ten civilians (6 Azerbaijani and 4 Armenian) were killed in the conflict. Various non-official Azerbaijani sources, per research of social networks, put the actual number of Azerbaijani soldiers killed at 94, while two remain missing.{{cite web|url=http://www.azadliq.info/129468.html|title=Son döyüşlərdəki şəhidlərimizin sayı 93-ə çatdı (Qeyri-rəsmi siyahı)|work=Azadliq|accessdate=22 April 2016}} According to Christoph Bierwirth, [[UN High Commission for Refugees|UNHCR]] representative in Armenia, more than 2,000 people left Nagorno-Karabakh for Armenia amid the clashes.[http://www.panorama.am/en/news/2017/06/20/2016-NK-conflict-escalation-UNHCR-representative-Armenia/1795923 More than 2000 people left Karabakh for Armenia amid 2016 NK conflict escalation – UNHCR representative in Armenia]. ''Panorama.am''. 20 June 2017. ===Analysis=== In the aftermath, there was no conclusive assessment on the outcome of the clashes.{{cite web|last1=Akhundov|first1=Sabir|title="Azerbaijanism"|url=https://opendemocracy.net/od-russia/sabir-akhundov/azerbaijanism|publisher=[[openDemocracy]]|date=3 August 2016|quote=The result was inconclusive...}} [[Neil Melvin]], director of the armed conflict and conflict management programme at the [[Stockholm International Peace Research Institute]], stated that "Azerbaijan suffered heavy losses for relatively minor territorial gains, this is nonetheless seen as a victory, after 25 years of a sense of having been defeated".{{cite web|url=http://www.intellinews.com/nagorno-karabakh-the-slow-motion-conflict-98051/|title=bne IntelliNews - Nagorno-Karabakh: the slow-motion conflict|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}} Several analysts noted that the clashes did not result in significant changes.{{cite journal|last1=Liakhov|first1=Peter|title=Behind the Four-Day War|journal=[[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]]|date=April 2016|url=https://www.jacobinmag.com/2016/04/armenia-azerbaijan-nagorno-karabakh-war/|quote=By the fourth day, with at least one hundred and seventy two people killed and negligent territorial gains or losses...}} Matthew Bodner wrote in ''[[The Moscow Times]]'' on 6 April that "the previous status quo has been more-or-less preserved."{{cite news|last1=Bodner|first1=Matthew|title=How Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict Could Spark Major International Crisis|url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/how-nagorno-karabakh-conflict-could-spark-major-international-crisis/564934.html|work=[[The Moscow Times]]|date=6 April 2016|quote=By the time both sides stopped shooting at each other on April 5, it indeed appeared that the previous status quo has been more-or-less preserved.}} Independent Armenian journalist [[Tatul Hakobyan]], who visited the fighting scene during the clashes, remarked that the death of scores of soldiers of both sides was "senseless" as no real change occurred. He stated: "Azerbaijan did not win and Armenia did not lose."{{cite web|last1=Hakobyan|first1=Tatul|authorlink1=Tatul Hakobyan|title=Պատերազմի առաջին զոհը ճշմարտությունն է, եւ լրագրողներս պետք է այն հասցնենք հանրությանը|url=http://www.aniarc.am/2016/04/14/tatul-hakobyan-gagik-aghbalian/|publisher=ANI Foundation for Armenian Studies|language=hy|date=14 April 2016|quote=Սա չորսօրյա պատերազմ է, որտեղ ադրբեջանական կողմը չհաղթեց, իսկ հայկական կողմը չպարտվեց: Սա ես համարում եմ ողբերգություն, որովհետեւ անիմաստ սպանվեցին տասնյակ մարդիկ եւ եղան հարյուրավոր վիրավորներ:}} Russian military expert Vladimir Yevseyev said that the Azerbaijani offensive, despite initial victory, was not a success because the Azerbaijani side has numerous killed soldiers and destroyed tanks.{{cite web|url=http://en.a1plus.am/1232879.html|title=Russian expert: The Armenian side can strike a big blow to Azerbaijan’s economy (video)|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}} The [[International Crisis Group]] assessment stated that Azerbaijan gained "small but strategically important pieces of land".{{cite web|title=Nagorno-Karabakh: New Opening, or New Peril?|url=http://www.crisisgroup.org/en/regions/europe/south-caucasus/azerbaijan/239-nagorno-karabakh-new-opening-or-more-peril.aspx|publisher=International Crisis Group|date=4 July 2016}} Russian military analyst [[Pavel Felgenhauer]] believes that Azerbaijan "won the first round of fighting".{{cite web|last1=Фельгенгауэр|first1=Павел|title=Баку побеждает в первом раунде|url=http://www.novayagazeta.ru/politics/72578.html|website=Новая Газета|accessdate=10 June 2016}} Former minister of defense of Nagorno-Karabakh [[Samvel Babayan]] stated that the territories gained by Azerbaijan have strategic importance, and they were lost by Armenians within one hour.{{cite web|title=Самвел Бабаян: "Легко говорить, что вы в Баку будете пить чай. Скорее, наоборот"|url=http://www.armenianreport.com/pubs/131568/|website=Armenianreport.com|accessdate=3 June 2016}} Karabakh and Armenia government rejected his criticism.{{cite web|url=https://www.armenianow.com/en/karabakh/2016/06/02/armenia-former-commander-karabakh-samvel-babayan-criticism/4348/|title=Response to Babayan: Armenian officials downplay criticism from Karabakh’s ex-commander - ArmeniaNow.com|first=GOHAR|last=ABRAHAMYAN|website=www.armenianow.com|accessdate=26 June 2017}} [[Chatham House]] fellow [[Zaur Shiriyev]], suggested that Azerbaijan prompted a "carefully controlled escalation [that] served to raise international awareness of the fragility of a status quo which Azerbaijan regards as unfavourable, in order to galvanize the international mediators and put pressure on Yerevan to be constructive at the negotiating table."{{cite web|last1=Shiriyev|first1=Zaur|title=Violence in Nagorny Karabakh a Reflection of Azerbaijan’s Security Dilemma|url=https://www.chathamhouse.org/expert/comment/violence-nagorny-karabakh-reflection-azerbaijan-s-security-dilemma|publisher=[[Chatham House]]|date=22 April 2016}} British journalist [[Thomas de Waal]], senior associate at the [[Carnegie Endowment for International Peace]] and author of ''[[Black Garden|Black Garden: Armenia and Azerbaijan Through Peace and War]]'', does not believe that the Azerbaijani offensive was meant as a full-scale military operation but rather as a limited attempt to bring the conflict back on the international agenda and put Armenia under pressure. He believes that after the April violence, the conflict is unlikely to return to its semi-quiet state and that a new round of fighting would be harder to contain than previous conflicts.Thomas de Waal. [http://carnegieeurope.eu/2016/06/16/prisoners-of-caucasus-resolving-karabakh-security-dilemma/j1yq Prisoners of the Caucasus: Resolving the Karabakh Security Dilemma]. Carnegie Europe. 16 June 2016. Christine Philippe-Blumauer noted, "Russian official reactions suggest that Russian troops would not actually decide to intervene in favor of the Armenian side, should the conflict scale-up to a fully-fledged war yet again."{{cite web|last1=Philippe-Blumauer|first1=Christine|title=Nagorno-Karabakh: A Conflict Entrenched in Nationalistic Propaganda|url=http://www.fpri.org/2016/05/nagorno-karabakh-conflict-entrenched-nationalistic-propaganda/|publisher=[[Foreign Policy Research Institute]]|date=5 May 2016}} [[Russia]] was the one who benefited most from the four-day-clashes. During the early days of the conflict, [[Moscow]] adopted a reserved attitude, and after within only few hours, most probably brokered the ceasefire. The [[OSCE Minsk Group]] organized a meeting only after several days the conflict sparked, and the parties declared the ceasefire even before the meeting took place.{{cite web|url=https://www.osw.waw.pl/en/publikacje/analyses/2016-04-06/four-day-war-nagorno-karabakh|title=The four-day war in Nagorno-Karabakh|publisher=OSW|date=27 November 2018}} Following the conflict, [[Russia]] started to increase political and ecnonomic ties with both [[Azerbaijan]] and [[Armenia]]. In [[Yerevan]], [[Gazprom]] agreed to increase gus supply to Armenia, and decreased the price of gas, which was already low. In [[Baku]], Russian foreign minister [[Sergei Lavrov]] had a discussion about a railway line from Russia to [[Iran]] through Azerbaijan. However, Russia alone is not entirely stabilising influence. [[Dmitry Rogozin]], a deputy prime minister said that Moscow is the biggest supplier of arms to both sides and will continue to be so in the future. People who worked on the settlement process said that none of the sides would have trust in a permanent peace established by Russia alone. As the former US ambassador to the Minsk Group, Mr Bryza puts it, "The key to resolving this is to get the two presidents to have sufficient trust in each other, and Russia is not going to be able to do that". {{cite web|url=https://www.ft.com/content/3d485610-0572-11e6-9b51-0fb5e65703ce|title=Russia senses opportunity in Nagorno-Karabakh conflict|publisher=Financial Times|date=27 November 2018}} ===Official statements=== ;Armenian Armenian Defense Ministry Spokesman [[Artsrun Hovhannisyan]] stated that the Azerbaijani attempted to take part of northern Karabakh with a "[[blitzkrieg]]", which failed.{{cite news|last1=Mkrtchyan|first1=Marianna|title=Artsrun Hovhannisyan: Azerbaijan's attempt of blitzkrieg failed|url=http://www.arminfo.info/index.cfm?objectid=A35495F0-FA77-11E5-9D010EB7C0D21663|work=arminfo.info|date=4 April 2016}} After a ceasefire was reached NKR Defense Army Colonel Victor Arustamyan said that one military position was left under Azerbaijani control, which was of no strategic significance.{{cite news|last1=Ghazanchyan|first1=Siranush|title=32 Armenian soldiers dead, 121 wounded, 25 missing|url=http://www.armradio.am/en/2016/04/06/32-armenian-soldiers-killed-121-wounded-25-missing/|agency=[[Public Radio of Armenia]]|date=6 April 2016|quote=Colonel Arustamyan gave clarifications about an Armenian military position left under Azerbaijani control. Colonel [[Mais Barkhudarov]] was awarded with the rank of general-major by the Azerbaijani President because of his personally participation in the military operation over Lalatapa height.[http://en.axar.az/news/2847 Azerbaijani officer received the rank of General] // axar.az, 20 April 2016. ===Political harassment === [[Ali Karimli]], the leader of [[Azerbaijani Popular Front]] party, who criticized the Azerbaijani government over its actions during the clashes, became a subject of a series of protests (the latest one held on 12 April in front of Karimli’s house), organized by the authorities. The protesters also demanded to exile him from the country. According to the human rights lawyer [[Intigam Aliyev]], attacks against Karimli are simply diverting attention from truly important issues and testing technologies to distract people’s justified anger caused by the serious consequences of wrong decisions.{{cite web|url=https://www.meydan.tv/en/site/politics/13614/|title=Danger of attacks against Ali Karimli|first=|last=Meydan.TV|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.contact.az/docs/2016/Social/041300152857ru.htm#.V0hQG9hkhdg|title=Активисты гражданского общества выразили поддержку Али Керимли|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161004170252/http://www.contact.az/docs/2016/Social/041300152857ru.htm#.V0hQG9hkhdg|archive-date=4 October 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Russian TV channel [[Dozhd]] reported that the Azerbaijani authorities launched a criminal case against the direction and journalists of the Azerbaijani independent channel [[Meydan TV]] because of the publication of the list of Azerbaijani soldiers killed during the clashes in Nagorno-Karabakh. Their list consisted of 94 names, while the Defense Ministry of Azerbaijan confirmed only 31 deaths. According to the Meydan TV chief editor [[Emin Milli]], each person on their list really died in the clashes, and he stated that the Ministry of Defense of Azerbaijan could not deny this information.[https://tvrain.ru/teleshow/here_and_now/azerbajdzhanskih_zhurnalistov_nazvali_natspredateljami-408142/ За что азербайджанских журналистов назвали нацпредателями] // tvrain.ru 25 апреля 2016 == International reactions == === Supranational bodies === * {{flagu|EU}} – High Representative of the European Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy [[Federica Mogherini]] urged the parties "to stop the fighting immediately and observe the ceasefire".{{cite web | url =http://sputniknews.com/politics/20160402/1037381544/mogherini-nagorn-karabakh.html|title=Top EU Diplomat Mogherini Calls for End to Fighting in Nagorno-Karabakh|publisher=[[Sputnik News]]| date=2 April 2016| accessdate =2 April 2016}} * {{flagu|UN}} – Secretary General [[Ban Ki-moon]] demanded all sides involved in the conflict to immediately cease all armed hostilities and observe the terms of ceasefire.{{cite web | url =http://ria.ru/world/20160402/1401551089.html |title=Генсек ООН призвал немедленно прекратить столкновения в Карабахе|publisher=[[RIA Novosti]]|language=Russian| date=2 April 2016| accessdate =2 April 2016}} * [[Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe|PACE]] – President of the [[Parliamentary Assembly of the Council of Europe]] [[Pedro Agramunt]] called on both sides to respect the ceasefire and resume peaceful negotiations. He also called for the withdrawal of all Armenian armed troops from occupied Azerbaijani territories in compliance with the [[List of United Nations Security Council resolutions on the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict|UN Security Council resolutions]].{{cite web | url =http://assembly.coe.int/nw/xml/News/News-View-EN.asp?newsid=6094&lang=2&cat=15 |title=PACE President calls for respect of cease fire in Nagorno-Karabakh|publisher=PACE|language=English| date=3 April 2016| accessdate =3 April 2016}} * {{flagu|OIC}} – The [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation]] condemned "the attack by Armenian forces on the borders of occupied Azerbaijani territories" and Yerevan’s "disrespect of the unilateral ceasefire" announced by Baku.{{cite web|url=http://www.citizen.co.za/afp_feed_article/nagorny-karabakh-clashes-continue-despite-azerbaijan-ceasefire/|title=Nagorny Karabakh clashes continue despite Azerbaijan ‘ceasefire’|publisher=The Citizen|language=English|date=3 April 2016|accessdate=3 April 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20160404225910/http://www.citizen.co.za/afp_feed_article/nagorny-karabakh-clashes-continue-despite-azerbaijan-ceasefire/|archivedate=4 April 2016|df=dmy-all}} * [[CSTO]] – A spokesman for the head of the CSTO, [[Nikolay Bordyuzha]], stated that the conflict must be settled through negotiations. Bordyuzha added that the Azerbaijani side is "leading to the escalation of the situation and the conflict".{{cite news|title=CSTO Chief Blames Baku For Escalation In Karabakh|url=http://www.azatutyun.am/content/article/27650276.html|agency=Azadutyun|date=2 April 2016}} === OSCE Minsk Group and co-chair countries === * [[OSCE Minsk Group]] – The Co-Chairs of the OSCE Minsk Group expressed "grave concern over the reported large-scale ceasefire violations that are taking place along the line of contact in the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict zone" and strongly condemned "the use of force and regret the senseless loss of life, including civilians".{{cite web | url =http://sputniknews.com/europe/20160402/1037378602/nagorno-karabakhconflict-osce.html|title=OSCE Minsk Group Calls for Ending Hostilities in Nagorno-Karabakh (VIDEO)|publisher=[[Sputnik News]]| date=2 April 2016| accessdate =2 April 2016}} The OSCE Minsk Group scheduled to have a meeting on 5 April in [[Vienna]] over the incidents.{{cite news|title=OSCE Minsk Group to Discuss Nagorno-Karabakh Escalated Tensions on April 5|url=http://sputniknews.com/politics/20160402/1037386131/osce-conflict-minsk.html|accessdate=3 April 2016|agency=Sputnik International|date=2 April 2016}} * {{flag|United States}} – The [[United States Department of State|State Department]] condemned ceasefire violations and urged the sides to "show restraint, avoid further escalation, and strictly adhere to the ceasefire." Their statement continued, "The unstable situation on the ground demonstrates why the sides must enter into an immediate negotiation under the auspices of the OSCE Minsk Group Co-Chairs on a comprehensive settlement of the conflict. We reiterate that there is no military solution to the conflict. As a co-chair country, the United States is firmly committed to working with the sides to reach a lasting and negotiated peace."{{cite web|url=https://www.state.gov/secretary/remarks/2016/04/255432.htm|title=United States Condemns Ceasefire Violations Along Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact|work=U.S. Department of State}} * {{flag|Russia}} – President [[Vladimir Putin]] called on both sides to end hostilities and show restraint.{{cite web|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-russia-call-for-restraint-after-outbreak-of-fighting-in-nagorno-karabakh-1459685441|title=U.S., Russia Call for Restraint After Outbreak of Fighting in Nagorno-Karabakh|author=Nathan Hodge|date=3 April 2016|work=WSJ}} On 4 April Foreign Minister [[Sergey Lavrov]] criticized what he called Turkey's interference into the internal affairs of neighboring nations and called Turkey's strong support for Azerbaijan "one-sided".{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-mideast-crisis-russia-syria-turkey-idUSKCN0X10XT|title=Turkey must stop meddling in other states' affairs, end support of terrorism, Russia says|author=Reuters Editorial|date=4 April 2016|work=Reuters}} === Other states === * {{flagu|Belarus}} – The Ministry of Foreign Affairs urged the parties to continue seeking a peaceful solution to the conflict "in accordance with the generally recognized principles and norms of international law, first of all, on the basis of respect and guaranteeing of the sovereignty, territorial integrity and inviolability of borders, as well as the relevant [[List of United Nations Security Council resolutions on the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict|UN Security Council resolutions]] and decisions of the OSCE". The Belarusian ambassador to Armenia was summoned to be informed that Yerevan was "deeply bewildered" by this statement which "does not correspond to the spirit of the Armenian-Belarusian relations" and "is detrimental to the negotiation process".{{cite web | url =http://vestnikkavkaza.net/news/Yerevan-isn%E2%80%99t-satisfied-with-support-of-Azerbaijan-s-territorial-integrity-by-Minsk.html|title=Yerevan is dissatisfied with Minsk's support for Azerbaijan's territorial integrity|publisher=Vestnik Kavkaza|language=English| date=3 April 2016| accessdate =3 April 2016}}{{cite web | url =http://arka.am/en/news/politics/yerevan_bewildered_over_belarus_position_on_karabakh_conflict/|title=Yerevan bewildered over Belarus position on Karabakh conflict|publisher=Arka.am|language=English| date=3 April 2016| accessdate =3 April 2016}} Belarusian president [[Alexander Lukashenko]] insisted that both sides should seek a peaceful dialogue.{{cite news|title=Lukashenko calls for dialogue between Nagorny Karabakh conflict parties|url=http://eng.belta.by/president/view/lukashenko-calls-for-dialogue-between-nagorny-karabakh-conflict-parties-90200-2016/|agency=Belarus News|date=4 April 2016}} * {{flagu|Bulgaria}} – Foreign Ministry of Bulgaria has expressed deep concern about "massive violations of the ceasefire". Bulgaria reiterated its position that the conflict could only be solved through peace talks mediated by the OSCE Minsk Group.{{cite web|url=http://www.novinite.com/articles/173862/|title=Bulgaria Concerned about Ceasefire Violations in Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict|publisher=[[Novinite]]|date=4 April 2016|access-date=4 April 2016}} * {{flagu|Canada}} – Minister of Foreign Affairs [[Stéphane Dion]] called on all sides to show restraint, immediately return to a true ceasefire, and actively resume dialogue within the framework of OSCE Minsk Group. "Canada firmly believes that there is no alternative to a peaceful, negotiated solution to this conflict," Minister Dion said in a statement.{{cite web | url =http://armenpress.am/eng/news/842038/canada-calls-for-true-ceasefire-in-nagorno-karabakh.html|title=Canada calls for true ceasefire in Nagorno-Karabakh|publisher=armenpress.am|language=English| date=4 April 2016| accessdate =4 April 2016}}{{cite web | url =http://en.trend.az/azerbaijan/karabakh/2514051.html|title=Canada calls for restraint in Nagorno-Karabakh|publisher=trend.az|language=English| date=4 April 2016| accessdate =4 April 2016}} * {{flagu|Chile}} – Initially the [[Chamber of Deputies of Chile]] issued a resolution passed unanimously that condemned the "armed attack of Azerbaijan against the Nagorno Karabakh Republic". According to the resolution, "on the night of 1 to 2 of last April, ground forces and air of the Republic of Azerbaijan conducted a large-scale attack on the border with the Republic of Nagorno-Karabakh, with heavy artillery and last generation missiles". The Chamber of Deputies of Chile reaffirmed its commitment to peace and urged the Republic of Azerbaijan for the immediate cessation of all acts of war against the Republic of Nagorno-Karabakh and the strict observance of the truce signed by both countries in 1994.{{cite web|url=http://asbarez.com/150548/|title=Chile Condemns ‘Azeri Aggression Against the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic’ - Asbarez.com|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}} However, just two weeks later, the [[Senate of Chile]], followed by the same Chamber of Deputies, adopted resolutions reaffirming Chile's recognition of Azerbaijan's territorial integrity, acknowledging the democratic progress in the country and calling on the international community to assist Azerbaijan and Armenia in resolving the conflict on the basis of the [[List of United Nations Security Council resolutions on the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict|UN Security Council resolutions 822, 853, 874 and 884]].[http://www.senado.cl/senado-saluda-98-anos-de-la-existencia-de-la-republica-de-azerbaiyan-y-reconoce-su-soberania-e-integridad-territorial/prontus_senado/2016-05-31/193923.html Senado saluda 98 años de la existencia de la República de Azerbaiyán y reconoce su soberanía e integridad territorial].[https://www.camara.cl/prensa/noticias_detalle.aspx?prmid=129672 DIPUTADOS RESPALDAN GESTIONES INTERNACIONALES PARA RESOLVER CONFLICTO ENTRE AZERBAIYÁN Y ARMENIA]. * {{flagu|Czech Republic}} – Foreign Ministry expressed concern over extensive violations of the ceasefire on the line of contact of Nagorno-Karabakh conflict and condemned the use of force. It called to involved parties to stop the violence and to strictly respect the truce. Foreign Ministry supported the peaceful efforts of the OSCE Minsk Group.{{cite web|url=http://www.mzv.cz/jnp/cz/udalosti_a_media/prohlaseni_a_stanoviska/x2016_04_03_zpravami_o_rozsahlem_porusovani_primeri.html|title=Prohlášení MZV k porušování příměří v oblasti konfliktu v Náhorním Karabachu|publisher=Ministerstvo zahraničních věcí České republiky|date=3 April 2016|access-date=4 April 2016}} * {{flagu|Cyprus}} – Foreign Ministry statement accused Azerbaijan of violations of the armistice line and urged Azerbaijan to "respect the ''[[status quo ante bellum|status quo ante]]''." web|url=http://www.mfa.gov.cy/mfa/mfa2006.nsf/index_en/index_en?OpenDocument |title=The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic denounces the use of force and the loss of life in Nagorno-Karabakh, Dışişleri Bakanlığı}} He also announced his country's support to Azerbaijan in the Nagorno-Karabakh border clashes, saying "Turkey backs the Azerbaijanis 'to the end' against Armenia".{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-35953358|title=Nagorno-Karabakh clash: Turkey backs Azeris 'to the end' against Armenia – BBC News|website=BBC News|language=en-GB|access-date=3 April 2016}} Turkey is also trying to get the [[Organization of Islamic Cooperation]] to support Azerbaijan.{{cite web|url=http://www.armenialiberty.org/content/article/27670976.html|title=Turkey Seeks Muslim Support For Azerbaijan Over Karabakh|work=«Ազատ Եվրոպա/Ազատություն» ռադիոկայան|accessdate=22 April 2016}} In his another statement, Recep Tayyip Erdoğan pointed out that the passivity of the OSCE Minsk Group led the situation to this point. {{cite web|url=https://www.aa.com.tr/tr/turkiye/cumhurbaskani-erdogan-minsk-uclusunun-zaaflari-durumu-bu-noktaya-tasimis-oldu/548295|title=Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan: Minsk Üçlüsü'nün zaafları durumu bu noktaya taşımış oldu|work=Anadolu Agency|accessdate=23 November 2018}} * {{flagu|Ukraine}} – According to a statement by the [[Foreign Ministry of Ukraine]] "Ukraine favors a long-term political solution to the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict on the basis of respect for the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the Republic of Azerbaijan within its internationally recognized borders". Other reactions * U.S. Congressmen and co-chairs of the Congressional Caucus on Armenian Issues [[Frank Pallone]] (D-NJ), [[Robert Dold]] (R-IL), [[Adam Schiff]] (D-CA), and [[Brad Sherman]] (D-CA) jointly condemning what they described as "Azerbaijan's aggression" and called upon the Obama administration to "hold Ilham Aliyev to account for his unilateral escalation of violence against Nagorno-Karabagh."{{cite news|title=Congressional Leaders Condemn Devastating Azerbaijani Attacks on NKR|url=http://armenianweekly.com/2016/04/04/congressional-leaders-condemn-baku/|work=[[Armenian Weekly]]|date=4 April 2016}} In a separate statement, Congressman [[Jim Costa]] (D-CA) called upon Azerbaijan to "reverse its pattern of escalating violence against the peaceful people of Nagorno Karabakh".{{cite news|title=Congressman Jim Costa deplores Azeri attack against Karabakh|url=http://www.armradio.am/en/2016/04/05/congressman-jim-costa-deplores-azeri-attack-against-karabakh/|agency=Public Radio of Armenia|date=5 April 2016}} * The [[Basque Parliament]] unilaterally adopted a statement, condemning the Azerbaijani attempts to solve the Karabakh conflict in a military way. The statement notes that on 2 April 2016, Azerbaijan unilaterally launched an unprecedented attack on Nagorno Karabakh which has caused dozens of deaths, including four civilians, one of them a child. The Basque Parliament also supports the Minsk Group negotiation process where Nagorno Karabakh must have a place.{{cite web|url=http://rus.azatutyun.am/content/article/27677038.html|title=Парламент Страны Басков: 2 апреля нападение предпринял Азербайджан|work=Радио Свобода|accessdate=22 April 2016}} * [[Selahattin Demirtaş]], leader of the left-wing pro-Kurdish [[Peoples' Democratic Party (Turkey)|Peoples' Democratic Party]] (HDP), criticised Turkish President [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] and Prime Minister [[Ahmet Davutoğlu]] for encouraging violence with their support for military actions. He added, "Nagorno-Karabakh was an autonomous region. Armenia and Azerbaijan had to settle the issue around the negotiating table, as war will be of no benefit to either side."{{cite news|title=Demirtaş: Hükümet Karabağ'a körükle gidiyor Paylaş|url=http://www.agos.com.tr/tr/yazi/14924/demirtas-hukumet-karabag-a-korukle-gidiyor|work=[[Agos]]|date=5 April 2016|language=tr}}{{cite news|title=Pro-Kurdish Leader Blames Turkey for Karabakh Re-Escalation|url=http://asbarez.com/148374/pro-kurdish-leader-blames-turkey-for-karabakh-re-escalation/|work=[[Asbarez]]|date=5 April 2016}} *Parliamentarians of Greek and Latvian Parliaments, Garifalia Kanelli and [[Sergejs Potapkins]] respectively, visited the [[Republic of Nagorno-Karabakh]] after the clashes. According to Potapkins, it is inadmissible, when the peaceful population suffers from the military aggression. The re-establishment of peace is a prior problem, the escalations of the conflict don’t promote the establishment and maintenance of peace.{{cite web|url=http://www.panorama.am/en/news/2016/04/11/Artsakh/1560990|title=Greek and Latvian parliamentarians visit Artsakh|author=Helix Consulting LLC|publisher=|accessdate=12 April 2016}} * A large number of French parliamentarians, senators and mayors in a joint statement announced that the [[Republic of Nagorno-Karabakh]] should be readmitted to the negotiating table. According to them, "encouraged by international indifference, Azerbaijan under the rule of [[Ilham Aliyev]] attempted to regain by force its former colony, the Republic of Nagorno Karabakh", deliberately targeting cities, killing children in the courtyard of their schools, and maiming civilians.{{cite web|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/europe/article/2016/04/07/l-osce-doit-reintegrer-la-republique-du-haut-karabagh-dans-les-negociations-de-paix_4897741_3214.html|title=L’OSCE doit réintégrer la République du Haut-Karabagh dans les négociations de paix|work=Le Monde.fr|accessdate=12 April 2016}} *On 12 April 21 French parliamentarians and senators signed a joint statement: "While the cease-fire obtained by the Minsk Group has already been undermined by the Azerbaijani side, the French authorities must point out that any continuation of the fighting will lead to unilateral recognition of the Nagorno-Karabakh Republic".{{cite web|url=http://www.liberation.fr/debats/2016/04/12/la-france-doit-agir-pour-la-paix-au-haut-karabakh_1445683|title=La France doit agir pour la paix au Haut-Karabakh|work=Libération.fr|accessdate=22 April 2016}} * 30 French Parliamentarians have appealed the French government to recognize the Republic of Karabakh.{{cite news|title=Soutien à l’appel de 30 parlementaires pour une initiative de la France|url=http://www.armenews.com/article.php3?id_article=124687|agency=Nouvelles d'Arménie Magazine|date=12 April 2016|language=French}} French conservative Senator [[Valérie Boyer]] accused Azerbaijan for the violence and expressed solidarity with the Armenian people and Nagorno-Karabakh.{{cite web|url=https://web.facebook.com/valerie.boyer.56/posts/470525819813555|title=Valérie Boyer – Le Haut-Karabagh a été une nouvelle fois... – Facebook|publisher=}}{{dead link|date=October 2016}} She also called for the official recognition of the NKR by France.{{cite news|title=Valérie Boyer (LR) : "Il faut désormais reconnaître le Haut-Karabagh"|url=http://www.valeursactuelles.com/politique/valerie-boyer-lr-il-faut-desormais-reconnaitre-le-haut-karabagh-60727|work=[[Valeurs Actuelles]]|date=6 April 2016|language=fr}} *[[Frank Engel (politician)|Frank Engel]], a Member of the [[European Parliament]] and Honorary Consul of Armenia in Luxembourg, called for the recognition of Artsakh's independence, to avoid repletion of the [[Armenian Genocide]]. He accused Azerbaijan for aggression in Karabakh earlier in April, which showed that some people living on the Caspian Sea shore dream of a new genocide in Nagorno Karabakh.{{cite web|url=http://www.arminfo.am/index.cfm?objectid=439CA020-095F-11E6-9C2F0EB7C0D21663|title=Arminfo: MEP Frank Engel comes out for recognition of Nagorno-Karabakh's independence|publisher=|accessdate=19 May 2016}} * U.S. Congressmen [[David Cicilline]] (D-RI), [[James Langevin]] (D-RI), [[Jack Reed (politician)|Jack Reed]] (D-RI) condemned the Azerbaijani military operation against Karabakh in three separate statements. In his statement, Reed said: "These attacks on the Armenian people are completely unacceptable and call into question the sincerity with which Azerbaijan has approached recent peace negotiations." While Cicilline stated: "I strongly condemn the use of sniper attacks by the Azerbaijani government, which is in direct violation of the cease-fire agreement and international law, and am appalled by reports that Azerbaijan forces attacked a Red Cross envoy."{{cite news|title=RI Lawmakers Condemn Azerbaijani Offensive against NKR|url=http://armenianweekly.com/2016/04/12/ri-nkr/|agency=Armenian Weekly|date=12 April 2016}} *The [[Los Angeles]] City Hall was lit in the colors of the Armenian flag in view of the incident. A vigil was also held to promote a peaceful resolution to the conflict and to condemn the Azerbaijan for "outrageous militarization and vicious attacks", as stated by [[Paul Krekorian]], one of the organizers of the vigil.{{cite news|title=Los Angeles City Hall lit up in Armenian tri-color|url=http://www.panarmenian.net/eng/news/210206/|agency=PanArmenian|date=13 April 2016}}{{cite news|title=Vigil at LA City Hall following attack on Armenians in Azerbaijan|url=http://www.scpr.org/news/2016/04/12/59531/vigil-at-la-city-hall-following-attack-on-armenian/|agency=KPCC}} * Turkish human rights activist [[Sait Çetinoğlu]] marked the support of Turkish authorities to Azerbaijan and called it a policy when the "genocide is exported out of borders of the state".{{cite web|url=http://news.am/eng/news/323754.html|title=Cetinoglu: Ankara’s support for Baku is exporting of genocide policy|publisher=|accessdate=19 May 2016}} * [[US Congress]]woman [[Loretta Sanchez]], a senior member of the [[House Armed Services Committee]], called for a "[[Leahy Law]]" investigation into reports that the Azerbaijan armed forces, which annually receive millions of dollars in U.S. military aid, committed gross violations of human rights during Baku’s 2 April offensive against Nagorno-Karabakh.{{cite web|url=http://asbarez.com/149728/rep-loretta-sanchez-calls-for-leahy-law-investigation-of-azerbaijani-abuses/|title=Rep. Loretta Sanchez Calls for Leahy Law Investigation of Azerbaijani Abuses|work=Asbarez.com|accessdate=19 May 2016}} * US Senators [[Bill Barton (politician)|Bill Barton]] and [[Lois Tochtrop]] have condemned human rights violations by Azerbaijan as [[war crimes]]. According to them, "One heartbreaking account of Azerbaijan’s barbaric actions during the four-day war in April was the mutilated elders that journalists found in Talish after its recapture from Azerbaijani forces". Another violation was that "among the Azerbaijani officers Aliyev honored at a ceremony following the four-day war was the man who had posed with [Yezidi-Armenian soldier] Sloyan’s severed head."{{cite web|url=http://www.foreignpolicyjournal.com/2016/05/20/state-lawmakers-support-for-azerbaijan-encouraged-last-months-anti-armenian-war-crimes/|title=State Lawmakers’ support for Azerbaijan Encouraged Last Month’s Anti-Armenian War Crimes|first1=About the Author Senator Bill Barton Senator Bill|last1=Barton|first2=whose maternal family survived the Armenian|last2=Genocide|first3=was a Republican member of the Utah State Senate for 12 years He is a member of Utah's chapter of the Armenian National Committee of America Senator Lois Tochtrop Senator Lois Tochtrop was a Democratic member of the Colorado General Assembly for 16 years She is a member of Colorado's chapter of the Armenian National Committee of|last3=America|date=20 May 2016|publisher=|accessdate=16 November 2016}} The societal reactions to the April clashes were different in [[Armenia]] and [[Azerbaijan]]. In Azerbaijan, the clashes surged patriotism in the public, and thousands of people volunteered to fight, yet the Ministry of Defence did not allow them to do so. Even people with the critical voice could not hide their surprise at the intense and quick social mobilization. For this reason, the decleration of the ceasefire on April 5 led to the sense of dissapointment in the public. In Armenia, following the ceasefire, demonstrations took place in [[Yerevan]], which were caused by the anti-Russian attitudes that objected to [[Moscow]]’s arms sales to [[Baku]]. Even though the Armenian officials firstly emphasized the effective performance of the Armenian army, there was a growing public dissapointment about the complacency and corruption in the army. Out-of-date equipment and poor communication lines were believed to be the cause for the death of many Armenian soldiers within the first few hours of the clashes. After the decleration of the ceasefire, four high-ranking army officials were dismissed from their position. {{cite web|url=http://www.chathamhouse.org/publication/nagorny-karabakh-conflict-defaulting-war|title=The Nagorny Karabakh Conflict: Defaulting to War|work=Russia and Eurasia Programme|accessdate=24 November 2018}} == See also == {{Commons category|2016 Armenian–Azerbaijani clashes}} *[[Nagorno-Karabakh conflict]] *[[Armenia–Azerbaijan relations]] == References == '''Notes''' {{notelist}} '''Citations''' {{reflist}} {{Portalbar|Armenia|Azerbaijan|Military history|2010s}} {{Nagorno-Karabakh Conflict}} {{Post-Cold War European conflicts}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2016 Armenian-Azerbaijani clashes}} [[Category:Nagorno-Karabakh conflict]] [[Category:Conflicts in 2016|Armenian-Azerbaijani clashes]] [[Category:2016 in Armenia]] [[Category:2016 in Azerbaijan]] [[Category:Battles involving Armenia]] [[Category:Battles involving the Republic of Artsakh]] [[Category:Battles involving Azerbaijan]] [[Category:Battles post-1945]] [[Category:Armenia–Azerbaijan border]] [[Category:April 2016 events]]

April 23, 1938, [[Chomakhtur]], [[Sharur Rayon|Sherur raion]], [[Nakhchivan ASSR]], [[Azerbaijan SSR]], [[USSR]]), [[Professor]] Doctor of philological sciences, one of the 91st, one of the most active founders of [[New Azerbaijan Party]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mediaforum.az/articles.php?article_id=20070402081935462&page=02&lang=az#.VI8BVcmZ2LA |title=1992-ci İLDƏ HEYDƏR ƏLİYEVİ HAKİMİYYƏTƏ ÇAĞIRAN 91 NƏFƏR («91-lər»in siyahısı) |author= |date=2007-04-02 |work= |publisher=mediaforum.az |accessdate=2014-12-15 |language=az}} == Life == Ajdar Ismailov finished [[Azerbaijan State University]], the faculty of philology in 1961. He was a teacher, school director, worker of "Sherg gapisi" newspaper of Ministry of Internal Affairs, in 1961-1977 and a teacher of literature in [[Nakhchivan State University]], senior teacher as assistant professor and [[professor]], in 1977-1994.[http://dmfa.nakhchivan.az/pdff/Naxcivan%20Ensiklopediyasi%20(I%20cild).pdf AMEA, Naxçıvan Ensiklopediyası, Naxçıvan-2005.] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141215170758/http://dmfa.nakhchivan.az/pdff/Naxcivan%20Ensiklopediyasi%20%28I%20cild%29.pdf |date=2014-12-15 }} == Scientific activity == He was the candidate of Literature Institute at Azerbaijan SSR Academy of Sciences named Nizami in 1969. He defended his candidacy dissertation "The historical dramas of Huseyn Javid" ("The Prophet", "Topal Teymur", "Seyavush", "Khayyam") under the leadership of academician Mammad Arif Dadashzade, the vice president of Academy, in 1974. He started to research for a doctoral thesis the topic of "Huseyn Javid's creative work and demonism tradition in world literature" confirmed at The Scientific Council of Literature Institute named after Nizami, in 1982. In here, the Huseyn Javid romanticism source is told to be started from Zarvan (Avesta) philosophy, contrary to the thoughts that the formation of Azerbaijan romanticism is related to the affairs of 1905-1917. The poet's devotion to the creative ways of prominent figures was researched in the demonism context, especially the Turkish "Tenzimat literature" from the point of view of philosophy / aesthetics. The development issues and sequel of demonism traditions at world romanticism in H. Javid legacy were researched in the book. Ajdar Ismailov indicated the philosophical idea, [[mythic fiction|mythological fiction]] roots of [[Huseyn Javid|H.Javid]] creativity and he researched national and universal motives in poet's world.{{cite web|url=http://ramazan-seyid.blogspot.com/2010/12/huseyn-cavidin-iblis-facisinin-sas.html |title=Hüseyn Cavidin "İBLİS" faciəsinin əsas qayəsi |author=Ramazan Seyidov |date=2010-12-29 |work= |publisher=ramazan-seyid.blogspot.com |accessdate=2014-06-10 |language=az}} == Political activity == He had been playing an active role in political life of Azerbaijan, since the end of 1980. He was against the invasion policy of Kreml, he supported H. Aliyev to back again to active politics and played a great role in establishment of the [[New Azerbaijan Party]]. == WORKS == === Scientific monographs === # “Romanticism tradition in world and Huseyn Javid”. Baki: Yazichi, 1982, 220 pages.{{cite web|url=http://ramazan-seyid.blogspot.com/2010/12/huseyn-cavidin-iblis-facisinin-sas.html |title=Hüseyn Cavidin "İBLİS" faciəsinin əsas qayəsi |author=Ramazan Seyidov |date=2010-12-29 |work= |publisher=ramazan-seyid.blogspot.com |accessdate=2014-06-10 |language=az}} # “Huseyn Javid tradition in Azerbaijan Soviet Literature” – methodical instruction. Baki. 1990. (It was printed by the order of 03.04.90 dated Azerbaijan ) # “Huseyn Javid creativity and the demonism tradition in world literature”. Baki. Elm, 1991. 224 pages. # “Ancient Fore Asia and Fore Caucasus Turkic tribes” (Armenians and Georgians in the land of Caucasian Oghuz Albania). Baki, “Nurlan”, 2008. 799 pages. (First publish in 2006) (It was printed by the decision of Scientific Council of History Institute of Azerbaijan Science Academy named after A.A. Bakikhanov)[http://elibrary.az/cgi/irbis64r/cgiirbis_64.exe?LNG=az&Z21ID=&I21DBN=IBIS&P21DBN=IBIS&S21STN=1&S21REF=5&S21FMT=fullwebr&C21COM=S&S21CNR=10&S21P01=0&S21P02=1&S21P03=A=&S21STR=%C4%B0smay%C4%B1lov,%20%C6%8Fjd%C9%99r%20Ta%C4%9F%C4%B1%20o%C4%9Flu İsmayılov, Əjdər Tağı oğlu]{{cite web|url=http://www.olaylar.az/news/culture/83131 |title="Qədim ön Asiya və ön Qafqaz türk tayfaları" erməni saxtakarlığını elmi əsaslarla ifşa edir |author= |date=2014-06-17 |work= |publisher=olaylar.az |accessdate=2014-12-15 |language=az}} == Selected articles and interviews == 1.
